title: Penalties for afks
body: So im curious about other players thoughts on penalties for afking and such, now, im not 100% sure how they work as I get marked as afk randomly some times(im assuming if enough people report you for something a bot auto does it) but i feel when a player afks there should be a vote to lock them from rejoining and give your team a buff of some kind and ban the account of that player, since the last month of playing every second game has had at least 2 afks, and getting tired of never having 5v5 games anymore

replies.body:
> im assuming if enough people report you for something a bot auto does it

That *shouldn't* happen. The way the system picks up afk/leavers is that it will allow a 5 minute "buffer" where you can "safely" afk/leave (this is to allow for certain faults with various systems that might cause a player to load late or get disconnected mid-match), then it will mark the player as AFK. The reports will be ignored if the system doesn't pick up anything substantial.

> i feel when a player afks there should be a vote to lock them from rejoining

Disagree. As I pointed out, the "buffer" allows for connection issues that might be out of a players control. To simply have someone "locked-out" of a match and potentially banned because they were gone for something they had no control over (which is likely something that has occurred for the first time in that match) is, quite simply, overkill. If it were a situation where a player had been gone for 15+ (perhaps even 10+) minutes, and the system had picked them up as an AFK/leaver in a recent game, then it *might* be a bit more viable (emphasis on "might").

Personally, I can't ever see such a system being used.

The main reason it won't be used, is because it actually could increase toxicity.

Say someone is playing poorly on your team, and if they just afk, you guys all get a buff, a lot of players would see that as reason to flame.

Systems like these are always going to be abusable in some situation.
